doctrine_statement.title: Full-Swarm Governance Execution Model
doctrine_statement.summary: The ChainBridge governance system operates under a full-swarm execution model where all 12 agents are available for parallel deployment across execution lanes. This doctrine establishes swarm-first execution as the canonical operating paradigm.

PRINCIPLE-001.name: Swarm-First Execution
PRINCIPLE-001.description: All governance operations default to full-swarm deployment unless explicitly constrained

PRINCIPLE-002.name: Parallel Lane Architecture
PRINCIPLE-002.description: Execution proceeds across parallel lanes for maximum throughput and redundancy

PRINCIPLE-003.name: Agent Availability
PRINCIPLE-003.description: All 12 agents (GID-01 through GID-12) are available for deployment at all times

PRINCIPLE-004.name: Proof Precedence
PRINCIPLE-004.description: Proof artifacts must be generated before execution proceeds

PRINCIPLE-005.name: Human Authority Supremacy
PRINCIPLE-005.description: JEFFREY (Architect) retains absolute override authority over all operations

governance_artifacts.artifact_chain: PAC → Agent Execution → WRAP Collection → BER Generation → Ledger Commit

CONS-DOC-001.rationale: Doctrine stability requires explicit authorization for any reversal

CONS-DOC-002.rationale: Consistency in execution model ensures predictable governance

precedent_chain.precedent_policy: All future full-swarm executions must achieve BER ≥ 100 to establish precedent

attestation.statement: Full-swarm governance execution model is hereby established as canonical doctrine for ChainBridge. This doctrine is LOCKED and may not be modified without explicit LAW-tier PAC authorization from the Architect.
